Key Match Events: Wales and Poland played a 0-0 draw after 90 minutes, sending the game to extra-time
Dan James had his penalty saved in the shootout, giving Poland the win
Chris Mepham saw red in the dying moments of extra time for his second yellow card
Pre-Game Insights: Wales FA chief executive Noel Mooney indicated that Rob Page's future was dependent on qualification
Poland are on their fifth manager since Rob Page took over at Wales
Post-Match Reflections: Rob Page's future hangs in the balance after Wales failed to qualify for Euro 2024
Wales will work out where to go from here after the loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in Cardiff, with a substantial and noisy Polish contingent in attendance
Wales had a goal ruled out before the break, with Ben Davies' header being disallowed by VAR
Others: Gareth Bale's departure was seen as a significant blow to Wales' chances, but they still fought hard to qualify
The game was a tense and closely contested affair, with both teams creating chances but ultimately unable to score
